edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils

Interface SequenceReader

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    SectionList
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ByteArraySequenceReader, FastaParser, FilteringSectionList, FilteringSequenceReader, RandomSectionList, TranslatingSequenceReader

    public interface SequenceReader
    Provides an interface for a buffered sequence reader, to return nucleotides and process parsers or mutation transparently.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    David Tulga

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the reader, and all sub-readers
      String getName()
      Returns the species name of this reader
      long getTotalSequence()
      Returns the total amount of sequence present in this reader
      byte read()
      Returns the next nucleotide
      int read(byte[] buffer, int length)
      Reads nucleotides into a byte array
      int readTranslated()
      Returns the next nucleotide, after mapping the byte through a translation table associated with the reader.
      void reset()
      reset the stream to the beginning.
      void seek(SequenceFragmentMetadata section)
      Set the location of the reader to that specified by the given SequenceFragmentMetadata, so that the next read() operation will return the first character of the specified SequenceFragment.
      void seek(SequenceFragmentMetadata section, long offset)
      Set the location of the reader to an offset beyond the location specified by the given SequenceFragmentMetadata, so that the next read() operation will return the character at that offset of the specified SequenceFragment.
      boolean setTranslationAlphabet(byte[] alphabet)
      Set the character mapping to be used when reading nucleotides.

          throws IOException,

        Returns the next nucleotide
        Returns:
        The next nucleotide, or EOF if the section or file has ended

      • read

        int read(byte[] buffer,
       int length)
         throws IOException,
                FilterException,
                NotEnoughSequenceException
        Reads nucleotides into a byte array
        Parameters:
        buffer - a byte[] to read into.
        length - how many nucleotides to read (must be less than or equal to the size of the given buffer)
        Returns:
        The number of nucleotides read
        Throws:
        IOException
        FilterException
        NotEnoughSequenceException

      • readTranslated

        int readTranslated()
                   throws IOException,
                          FilterException,
                          NotEnoughSequenceException,
                          TranslationException
        Returns the next nucleotide, after mapping the byte through a translation table associated with the reader. Typically used to map Roman characters representing nucleotides to the integers 0-3.
        Returns:
        The next nucleotide, using the translated alphabet, or EOF if the section or file has ended
        Throws:
        IOException
        FilterException
        NotEnoughSequenceException
        TranslationException
        See Also:
        setTranslationAlphabet(byte[] alphabet)

      • reset

        void reset()
        reset the stream to the beginning.

      • seek

        void seek(SequenceFragmentMetadata section)
          throws IOException
        Set the location of the reader to that specified by the given SequenceFragmentMetadata, so that the next read() operation will return the first character of the specified SequenceFragment.
        Parameters:
        section -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • seek

        void seek(SequenceFragmentMetadata section,
        long offset)
          throws IOException
        Set the location of the reader to an offset beyond the location specified by the given SequenceFragmentMetadata, so that the next read() operation will return the character at that offset of the specified SequenceFragment.
        Parameters:
        section -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setTranslationAlphabet

        boolean setTranslationAlphabet(byte[] alphabet)
        Set the character mapping to be used when reading nucleotides.
        Parameters:
        alphabet - A byte[] representing the byte translation table. The mapping is specified in reverse: the desired translated value is the index of the input array, and the values in the array are the corresponding input characters to be mapped. For example, the mapping 'A'->0, 'C'->1, 'G'->2, 'T'->3 is represented as new byte[]{'A','C','G','T'}.
        See Also:
        readTranslated()
